alert.note: Alert for Southeastern Brooks Range; Upper Kobuk and Noatak Valleys; Upper Koyukuk Valley (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued August 26 at 10:27AM AKDT until August 27 at 6:00PM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT THROUGH LATE SUNDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is possible. * WHERE...Including the following areas, Southeastern Brooks Range, Upper Kobuk and Noatak Valleys and Upper Koyukuk Valley. This includes the cities of Ambler, Shungnak, Kobuk, Wiseman, Coldfoot, Iniakuk Lake, Allakaket, Hughes, Bettles, And Gobblers Knob. * WHEN...Through late Sunday night. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Heavy rainfall exceeding 1 inch has fallen over the last 24 hours for the Central and Southwestern Brooks Range. Additional heavy rain is expected to move in this afternoon and last into the day Sunday with an additional 1 to 2 inches possible. Slate Creek, Colville River, and Kobuk River are already running high from recent rains and could push to near bank full this weekend. Smaller tributaries and streams may go out of their banks with the additional rain. - Http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.

area.areaDesc: Southeastern Brooks Range; Upper Kobuk and Noatak Valleys; Upper Koyukuk Valley
